commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ib752ad4c3aed525c4bea9dbd5710172ddbaf193b

commit_message:
Only use br-tun on network and compute nodes

Neutron-server does not use br-tun at all,
this is only needed at compute and network nodes.

Change-Id: I0e11baa3fc8ee15c951cf4fc9aaa3a1d47819e81
Closes-Bug: #1642521

commit_message:
Ensure that ironic services are enabled during upgrade

Not enabling the services in upgrade/settings caused issues in
ironic-inspector so this patch ensures that we add that here too.

Change-Id: I735f27bead768e49b3120c04ba49ae5930a60144

commit_message:
Add possibility to filter external plugins out

For the moment, each tempest run loads all installed external
plugins, reads them and loads list of tests.
But it is redundant, tempest user may want to use only some
specific plugin or none of them for different reasons.
Since we cannot just get and disable entry points that are installed
with packages we should be able to ignore them in tempest.
So, add config group called "ext_plugin" that will contain all
options related to external plugins and define first option there
called "plugin_names_matcher". This option expects any regexp
that will be applied to tempest plugin names. By default it is
empty string that means *all* plugins will be loaded.

Examples:
1) All plugins
[ext_plugins]
plugin_names_matcher = ''

2) Only plugins that contain word 'foo'
[ext_plugins]
plugin_names_matcher = foo #foo_tests, tests_for_foo

3) Only plugins that contain word 'foo' or 'bar'
[ext_plugins]
plugin_names_matcher = foo|bar # foo_tests, bar_tests

Change-Id: I24927aed3c44230f43c4baccd68bf37742db9e85
Closes-Bug: #1604097
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/30/343830/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import reimport stevedoreLOG = Noneext_plugins_group = cfg.OptGroup( name='ext_plugins', title="External Plugin Mechanism Options") ExtPluginsGroup = [ cfg.StrOpt( "plugin_names_matcher", default="", help=("Use this option to define matcher value that will be used for " "filtering out external plugins by their names. Useful when " "you have installed lots of different external plugins as " "entry points, and some of them either broken or undesired " "to be executed."), ), ] (ext_plugins_group, ExtPluginsGroup),def failure_hook(_, ep, err): global LOG LOG.error('Could not load %r: %s', ep.name, err) raise err ALL_PLUGINS = None ENABLED_PLUGINS = None def get_all_plugins(): global ALL_PLUGINS if not ALL_PLUGINS: ALL_PLUGINS = stevedore.ExtensionManager( 'tempest.test_plugins', invoke_on_load=True, propagate_map_exceptions=True, on_load_failure_callback=failure_hook, ) return ALL_PLUGINS def get_enabled_plugins(): global ENABLED_PLUGINS if not ENABLED_PLUGINS: matcher = re.compile(_CONF.ext_plugins.plugin_names_matcher) ENABLED_PLUGINS = [ p for p in get_all_plugins() if matcher.search(p.name)] return ENABLED_PLUGINS def get_plugin_load_tests_tuple(): load_tests_dict = {} for plug in get_enabled_plugins(): load_tests_dict[plug.name] = plug.obj.load_tests() return load_tests_dict def register_plugin_opts(conf): for plug in get_enabled_plugins(): try: plug.obj.register_opts(conf) except Exception: LOG.exception('Plugin %s raised an exception trying to run ' 'register_opts' % plug.name) def get_plugin_options_list(): plugin_options = [] for plug in get_enabled_plugins(): opt_list = plug.obj.get_opt_lists() if opt_list: plugin_options.extend(opt_list) return plugin_options def register_opts(): register_plugin_opts(_CONF) opt_list.extend(get_plugin_options_list()) self.ext_plugins = _CONF.ext_plugins global LOG

commit_message:
Remove ports on create_port timeout during instance build

When trying to allocate network for an booting instance,
if failed, Nova would retry for serveral times according
to CONF.network_allocate_retries. But before next
allocation task begins, there might be remaining ports of
this instance in Neutron(e.g. because Neutron does not
respond in time).

Nova should clean up the remaining ports before next retry.

Change-Id: I51edb4b0c351cc73ff61ba67f870718a0a59b01f
Closes-Bug: #1603909
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/483280/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Updating to the Pike document structure

From Pike the install guide moves into doc/source/install directory [1].
This change implements this in the cookiecutter template.

As this will be executed in an already existing doc folder the
cookiecutter needs to be called with -f parameter. This should
be updated into the "Installation tutorials and guides" [2].

[1]: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/pike/os-manuals-migration.html
[2]: https://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/project-install-guide.html

Change-Id: I9ea0b5aa3c4a49c79bec5036e5e4dad7f73e185a
Depends-On: Ia750cb049c0f53a234ea70ce1f2bbbb7a2aa9454
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

commit_message:
Fix parsing bug when config file is empty.

Method 'parse_file_contents' is expected to return
dict object after parsing the policy file, but
it will return None if file is empty currently.
Fix it.

Change-Id: I2841ccdb0f657fdb583e94d889cdd2685d7068b4

commit_message:
sphinxext: Use field lists in output

The 'sphinxext' module provided by 'oslo.config' uses field lists [1] for
its defaults. Provide some cross-promotional, deal mechanics, revenue
streams, jargon synergy between these two plugins (i.e. make them look
similar).

This message was approved by Jack Donaghy [2].

[1] http://docutils.sourceforge.net/docs/user/rst/quickref.html#field-lists
[2] https://youtu.be/aocZo3oeNxw

Change-Id: I6e478152a278a877ae37588be930b0b833eb09cd

subject: sphinxext: Format definition lists correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-05 09:47:25.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/sphinxext.py', 'oslo_policy/tests/test_sphinxext.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/b6aaf0094af305d80080f2b8befb10aeabbe0c07', 'message': 'sphinxext: Format definition lists correctly

In a definition list, a term must be immediately followed by an
(indented) definition. However, the current implementation added a
newline resulting in a paragraph followed by a blockquote. Resolve this
oversight.

Change-Id: If8dae36885be23b1784b8b1d7015b92bb630abbe
Closes-Bug: #1702442
'}]
commit_message:
sphinxext: Format definition lists correctly

In a definition list, a term must be immediately followed by an
(indented) definition. However, the current implementation added a
newline resulting in a paragraph followed by a blockquote. Resolve this
oversight.

Change-Id: If8dae36885be23b1784b8b1d7015b92bb630abbe
Closes-Bug: #1702442

commit_message:
Ensure that keystone restarts after db sync

When the db expand/migrate options are required,
the keystone service is stopped but never notified
to start again. This patch ensures that it is
properly stopped, and properly notified.

Change-Id: Ic49aded1bd0aa1933439e3fa5ba2d4321c6c2431

commit_message:
Migrate cinder-api under apache

Cinder ubuntu binary was already migrated under apache.
This change migrates rest of the distros/install types to
be executed under an apache process.

Change-Id: I8544eec5bfebf771d758f13abf4dfbc802f5d24f

commit_message:
Stop reading local config dirs for domain-specific file config driver

When a file-config-based domain-specific backend was loaded the
local config files from /etc/keystone/keystone.conf.d/ were also read. The
local config dir should not be used in this case.

Change-Id: Ib576c8f12a7cc4272e07bb057bf028d69649b65d
Related-Bug: #1489118
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/82/436882/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default_config_files=file_list, default_config_dirs=[])

commit_message:
Fix the object is unhashable when inheriting the class
"ComparableVersionedObject"

In python3, A class that overrides __eq__() and does not define
"__hash__()" will have its __hash__() implicitly set to None.
This will cause the set method to unhashable failed.
https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#object.__hash__

Change-Id: I21685303e9bd233241b7b4216e3feb7bdaecc0a4
Closes-Bug: #1687592
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/26/461726/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __hash__(self): return super(ComparableVersionedObject, self).__hash__()

commit_message:
Use ServerOsCollectConfigData value in output

Just use the value from the ServerOsCollectConfigData resource in the
output instead of recalculating the value for each role via jinja.

Change-Id: I4e3bf4f25c9a8f677d5d177eb409594193a86405
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/94/481594/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: value: {% for role in roles %} {{role.name}}: {get_attr: [{{role.name}}, attributes, os_collect_config]} {% endfor %}

commit_message:
DPDK and Host derive parameters workflows

This change is specific to DPDK and Host derive parameters
to apply the DPDK and Host specific formulas. this change
also updates the derive parameters in the plan
environment once derived.
Implements: blueprint tripleo-derive-parameters

Change-Id: I8c94f6d576ddd1c98729a70107f48871c40aba53

get_numa_nodes: <% $.nics %> - set_status_failed_get_dpdk_nics: <% not $.nics %> get_numa_nodes: publish: numa_nodes: <% $.nics.groupBy($.numa_node).select($[0]).orderBy($) %> on-success: - get_cpus_on_numa_nodes: <% $.numa_nodes %> - get_nics_count_on_numa_nodes: <% $.cpus %> - set_status_failed_get_cpus_on_numa_nodes: <% not $.cpus %> get_nics_count_on_numa_nodes: publish: nics_count: <% $.nics.groupBy($.numa_node).toDict($[0],$[1].len()) %> on-success: - get_nics_per_core: <% $.nics_count %> - set_status_failed_get_nics_count_on_numa_nodes: <% not $.nics_count %> get_nics_per_core: publish: nics_per_core: <% len($.cpus.values().first()[0]) %> on-success: - get_dpdk_core_list: <% $.nics_per_core %> - set_status_failed_get_nics_per_core: <% not $.nics_per_core %> get_dpdk_core_list: publish: dpdk_core_list: <% let(cpus => $.cpus, nics_count => $.nics_count, queue_length => $.no_of_queue_per_interface, nics_per_core => $.nics_per_core, nics_count => $.nics_count) -> list($.numa_nodes.select($cpus[str($)].take(switch((($nics_count[str($)]*$queue_length) mod $nics_per_core) > 0 => (int(($nics_count[str($)]*$queue_length)/$nics_per_core)+1), (($nics_count[str($)]*$queue_length) mod $nics_per_core) = 0 => int(($nics_count[str($)]*$queue_length)/$nics_per_core))).select($.join(",")))).join(",") %> on-success: - set_status_failed_get_dpdk_core_list: <% not $.dpdk_core_list %> set_status_failed_get_dpdk_nics: publish: status: FAILED message: 'Unable to determine DPDK NICs' on-success: fail set_status_failed_get_numa_nodes: publish: status: FAILED message: 'Unable to determine numa nodes for DPDK NICs' on-success: fail set_status_failed_get_cpus_on_numa_nodes: publish: status: FAILED message: 'Unable to determine get CPUs on NUMA nodes of DPKD NICs' on-success: fail set_status_failed_get_nics_count_on_numa_nodes: publish: status: FAILED message: 'Unable to determine NICs count on NUMA nodes' on-success: fail set_status_failed_get_nics_per_core: publish: status: FAILED message: 'Unable to determine NICs per core' on-success: fail set_status_failed_get_dpdk_core_list: publish: status: FAILED message: 'Unable to determine DPDK core list' on-success: fail

subject: Add log.get_loggers method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-26 15:15:08.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/log.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log/commit/08b854f6b22a7fd132fb1794a2ee3cf692a43c3f', 'message': "Add log.get_loggers method

In the Cinder project restarting the volume service is problematic
because it's not only in the control path but also in the data path of
some operations, so restarting it to change log levels is really
disruptive because it takes a long time to be done properly and it does
not support Active-Active configurations yet.

For this reason there's a specific API to change the log levels
dynamically based on a given prefix [1], but this feature is accessing
directly the `_loggers` dictionary which is not ideal.

This patch adds a simple method called `get_loggers` that will return a
copy of the internal `_loggers` dictionary so that the Cinder feature
can be changed to use this instead.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/445885

Change-Id: Ife33a5dd044a4565ad6a4d559ef9f0c108f260a3
"}]
commit_message:
Add log.get_loggers method

In the Cinder project restarting the volume service is problematic
because it's not only in the control path but also in the data path of
some operations, so restarting it to change log levels is really
disruptive because it takes a long time to be done properly and it does
not support Active-Active configurations yet.

For this reason there's a specific API to change the log levels
dynamically based on a given prefix [1], but this feature is accessing
directly the `_loggers` dictionary which is not ideal.

This patch adds a simple method called `get_loggers` that will return a
copy of the internal `_loggers` dictionary so that the Cinder feature
can be changed to use this instead.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/445885

Change-Id: Ife33a5dd044a4565ad6a4d559ef9f0c108f260a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/74/477574/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_loggers(): """Return a copy of the oslo loggers dictionary.""" return _loggers.copy()

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 05:11:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/osinfo.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_osinfo.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e1ba6153ba066169f66d2c339b2b6e333e1b2122', 'message': "Do not attempt to load osinfo if we do not have os_distro

We get a warning logged every time we try to load up osinfo
with an image metadata that does not have the 'os_distro'
property set. We should be smarter and just not try to load
osinfo at all if we know we cannot get results.

Change-Id: I79ebea3ed222fb0db01d0a33c62a677d0381f66c
Closes-Bug: #1675602
(cherry picked from commit 9910bade6fe7ffde1b11170f894e2876ed8ccdb4)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not attempt to load osinfo if we do not have os_distro

We get a warning logged every time we try to load up osinfo
with an image metadata that does not have the 'os_distro'
property set. We should be smarter and just not try to load
osinfo at all if we know we cannot get results.

Change-Id: I79ebea3ed222fb0db01d0a33c62a677d0381f66c
Closes-Bug: #1675602
(cherry picked from commit 9910bade6fe7ffde1b11170f894e2876ed8ccdb4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/49/451649/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('nova.virt.osinfo.LOG.warning') def test_hardware_properties_from_meta_no_os_distro(self, mock_warn): """Verifies that HardwareProperties attributes are not being set from image properties if there is no os_distro provided. """ img_meta = {'properties': {'hw_watchdog_action': 'disabled'}} img_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict(img_meta) with mock.patch.object(osinfo._OsInfoDatabase, 'get_instance') as get_instance: osinfo_obj = osinfo.HardwareProperties(img_meta) self.assertIsNone(osinfo_obj.network_model) self.assertIsNone(osinfo_obj.disk_model) get_instance.assert_not_called() mock_warn.assert_not_called()

commit_message:
Delete the Neutron config introduced with manila service

Now the default backend of manila service is LVM, so the
neutron config introduced by manila service is not needed now.

Change-Id: I1fb58d1479a62b307efcebc8294578e280ed1154

subject: Always set MTU when plugging devices
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 19:11:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/08487605484bc2361e0b229b05fb27d43b8d5d55', 'message': 'WIP: Always set MTU when plugging devices

neutron allows for customizable MTUs, while nova allows for in-place upgrades.
Recent versions of neutron have made significant changes to how MTUs are
calculated and a side effect of this is that possibility that the network MTU
can change. While we don't recommend doing such a thing, it does happen we can
make life a little easier for the users who do by configuring as much of the
network "plumbing" to use the new MTU when plugging interfaces.

This still leaves the user with the task of setting the MTU inside the guest
themselves, or waiting for the DHCP lease to expire so that the new MTU will be
pulled in.

Change-Id: If438e4816b425e6c5021a55567dcaaa77d1fffff

commit_message:
Always set MTU when plugging devices

neutron allows for customizable MTUs, while nova allows for in-place
upgrades.  Recent versions of neutron have made significant changes to
how MTUs are calculated and a side effect of this is that possibility
that the network MTU can change. While we don't recommend doing such a
thing, it does happen we can make life a little easier for the users who
do by configuring as much of the network "plumbing" to use the new MTU
when plugging interfaces.

This still leaves the user with the task of setting the MTU inside the
guest themselves, or waiting for the DHCP lease to expire so that the
new MTU will be pulled in.

Change-Id: If438e4816b425e6c5021a55567dcaaa77d1fffff
Closes-bug: #1649845
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/408781/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mtu = vif['network'].get_meta('mtu') if not linux_net.device_exists(v2_name): elif port == 'ovs': # NOTE(stephenfin): Handle MTU changes on the network (for example, # after an in-place live upgrade) by configuring it accordingly for dev in [v1_name, v2_name]: linux_net._set_device_mtu(mtu)

Add sfc osc plugin command reference

Partial-Implements: blueprint openstackclient-cli-porting

Depends-On: Ifeb62bad26ffeb0bb8b548c56d2d6a620a922f78
Change-Id: I241521299b8b73b8fa2f48c4498409524b715442
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/95/471695/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============== networking sfc ============== **Service Function Chaining** is a mechanism for overriding the basic destination based forwarding that is typical of IP networks. Service Function Chains consist of an ordered sequence of Service Functions (SFs). SFs are virtual machines (or potentially physical devices) that perform a network function such as firewall, content cache, packet inspection, or any other function that requires processing of packets in a flow from point A to point B even though the SFs are not literally between point A and B from a routing table perspective. Network v2 sfc port pair create -------------------- Create a port pair .. program:: sfc port pair create .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair create [--description <description>] --ingress <ingress> --egress <egress> [--service-function-parameters <[correlation=correlation_type, weight=weight]>] <name> .. option:: --description <description> Description for the port pair .. option:: --ingress <ingress> Ingress neutron port (name or ID) .. option:: --egress <egress> Egress neutron port (name or ID) .. option:: --service-function-parameters <[correlation=correlation_type, weight=weight]> Dictionary of Service function parameters. Currently, only correlation=None and weight is supported. Weight is an integer that influences the selection of a port pair within a port pair group for a flow. The higher the weight, the more flows will hash to the port pair. The default weight is 1. .. _sfc_port_pair_create-name: .. describe:: <name> Name of the port pair sfc port pair delete -------------------- Delete a given port pair .. program:: sfc port pair delete .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair delete <port-pair> .. _sfc_port_pair_delete-port-pair: .. describe:: <port-pair> Port pair to delete (name or ID) sfc port pair list ------------------ List port pairs .. program:: sfc port pair list .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair list [--long] sfc port pair set ----------------- Set port pair properties .. program:: sfc port pair set .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair set [--name <name>] [--description <description>] <port-pair> .. option:: --name <name> Name of the port pair .. option:: --description <description> Description for the port pair .. _sfc_port_pair_set-port-pair: .. describe:: <port-pair> Port pair to modify (name or ID) sfc port pair show ------------------ Show information of a given port pair .. program:: sfc port pair show .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair show <port-pair> .. _sfc_port_pair_show-port-pair: .. describe:: <port-pair> Port pair to display (name or ID) sfc port pair group create -------------------------- Create a port pair group .. program:: sfc port pair group create .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair group create [--description <description>] [--port-pair <port-pair>] [--port-pair-group-parameters <[lb_fields=lb_fields]>] <name> .. option:: --description <description> Description for the port pair group .. option:: --port-pair <port-pair> Port pair (name or ID). This option can be repeated. .. option:: --port-pair-group-parameters <[lb_fields=lb_fields]> Dictionary of port pair group parameters. Currently, only \'&\' separated string of the lb_fields are supported. .. _sfc_port_pair_group_create-name: .. describe:: <name> Name of the port pair group sfc port pair group delete -------------------------- Delete a given port pair group .. program:: sfc port pair group delete .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair group delete <port-pair-group> .. _sfc_port_pair_group_delete-port-pair-group: .. describe:: <port-pair-group> Port pair group to delete (name or ID) sfc port pair group list ------------------------ List port pair groups .. program:: sfc port pair group list .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair group list [--long] sfc port pair group set ----------------------- Set port pair group properties .. program:: sfc port pair group set .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair group set [--name <name>] [--description <description>] [--port-pair <port-pair>] [--no-port-pair] <port-pair-group> .. option:: --name <name> Name of the port pair group .. option:: --description <description> Description for the port pair group .. option:: --port-pair <port-pair> Port pair (name or ID). This option can be repeated. .. option:: --no-port-pair Remove all port pair from port pair group .. _sfc_port_pair_group_set-port-pair-group: .. describe:: <port-pair-group> Port pair group to modify (name or ID) sfc port pair group show ------------------------ Show information of a given port pair groups .. program:: sfc port pair group show .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair group show <port-pair-group> .. _sfc_port_pair_group_show-port-pair-group: .. describe:: <port-pair-group> Port pair group to display (name or ID) sfc port pair group unset ------------------------- Unset port pairs from port pair group .. program:: sfc port pair group unset .. code:: bash openstack sfc port pair group unset [--port-pair <port-pair>] [--all-port-pair] <port-pair-group> .. option:: --port-pair <port-pair> Remove port pair(s) from the port pair group (name or ID). This option can be repeated. .. option:: --all-port-pair Remove all port pairs from the port pair group .. _sfc_port_pair_group_unset-port-pair-group: .. describe:: <port-pair-group> Port pair group to unset (name or ID) sfc port chain create --------------------- Create a port chain .. program:: sfc port chain create .. code:: bash openstack sfc port chain create [--chain-parameters <[correlation=correlation_type, symmetric=boolean_type]>] [--description <description>] [--flow-classifier <flow-classifier>] [--port-pair-group <port-pair-group>] <name> .. option:: --chain-parameters <[correlation=correlation_type, symmetric=boolean_type]> Dictionary of chain parameters. Supports correlation=mpls and symmetric=true|false. .. option:: --description <description> Description for the port chain .. option:: --flow-classifier <flow-classifier> Flow classifier (name or ID). This option can be repeated. .. option:: --port-pair-group <port-pair-group> Port pair group (name or ID). This option can be repeated. .. _sfc_port_chain_create-name: .. describe:: <name> Name of the port chain sfc port chain delete --------------------- .. program:: sfc port chain delete .. code:: bash openstack sfc port chain delete <port-chain> .. _sfc_port_chain_delete-port-chain: .. describe:: <port-chain> Port chain to delete (name or ID) sfc port chain list ------------------- List port chains .. program:: sfc port chain list .. code:: bash openstack sfc port chain list [--long] sfc port chain show ------------------- Show information of a given port chain .. program:: sfc port chain show .. code:: bash openstack sfc port chain show <port-chain> .. _sfc_port_chain_show-port-chain: .. describe:: <port-chain> Port chain to display (name or ID) sfc port chain set ------------------ Set port chain's information .. program:: sfc port chain set .. code:: bash openstack sfc port chain set [--description <description>] [--flow-classifier <flow-classifier>] [--no-flow-classifier] [--port-pair-group <port-pair-group>] [--clear-port-pair-group] <port-chain> .. option:: --name <name> Name of the port chain .. option:: --description <description> Description for the port chain .. option:: --flow-classifier <flow-classifier> Flow classifier (name or ID). This option can be repeated. .. option:: --no-flow-classifier Associate no flow classifier with the port chain .. option:: --port-pair-group Port pair group (name or ID). This option can be repeated. .. option:: --clear-port-pair-group Clear associated port pair group from the port chain. At least one port pair group must be specified. .. _sfc_port_chain_set-port-chain: .. describe:: <port-chain> Port chain to modify (name or ID) sfc port chain unset -------------------- Unset port chain properties .. program:: sfc port chain unset .. code:: bash openstack sfc port chain unset [--flow-classifier <flow-classifier> | --all-flow-classifier] [--port-pair-group <port-pair-group>] <port-chain> .. option:: --flow-classifier <flow-classifier> Remove flow classifier(s) from the port chain (name or ID). This option can be repeated. .. option:: --all-flow-classifier Remove all flow classifiers from the port chain .. option:: --port-pair-group Remove port pair group(s) from the port chain (name or ID). This option can be repeated. .. _sfc_port_chain_unset-port-chain: .. describe:: <port-chain> Port chain to unset (name or ID) sfc flow classifier create -------------------------- Create a flow classifier .. program:: sfc flow classifier create .. code:: bash openstack sfc flow classifier create [--description <description>] [--destination-ip-prefix <destination-ip-prefix>] [--destination-port <destination-port>] [--ethertype <{IPv4,IPv6}>] [--l7-parameters <type=TYPE[,url=URL_PATH]>] [--logical-destination-port <logical-destination-port>] [--logical-source-port <logical-source-port>] [--protocol <protocol>] [--source-ip-prefix <source-ip-prefix>] [--source-port <source-port> <name> .. option:: --description <description> Description for the flow classifier .. option:: --destination-ip-prefix <destination-ip-prefix> Destination IP prefix or subnet .. option:: --destination-port <destination-port> Destination protocol port (allowed range [1,65535]. Must be specified as a:b, where a=min-port and b=max-port. .. option:: --ethertype <{IPv4,IPv6}> L2 ethertype, default is IPv4 .. option:: --l7-parameters <type=TYPE[,url=URL_PATH]> Dictionary of L7-parameters. Currently, no value is supported for this option. .. option:: --logical-destination-port <logical-destination-port> Neutron destination port (name or ID) .. option:: --logical-source-port <logical-source-port> Neutron source port (name or ID) .. option:: --protocol <protocol> IP protocol name. Protocol name should be as per IANA standard. .. option:: --source-ip-prefix <source-ip-prefix> Source IP prefix or subnet .. option:: --source-port <source-port Source protocol port (allowed range [1,65535]. Must be specified as a:b, where a=min-port and b=max-port. .. _sfc_flow_classifier_create-name: .. describe:: <name> Name of the flow classifier sfc flow classifier delete -------------------------- Delete a given flow classifier .. program:: sfc flow classifier delete .. code:: bash openstack sfc flow classifier delete <flow-classifier> .. _sfc_flow_classifier_delete-flow-classifier: .. describe:: <flow-classifier> Flow classifier to delete (name or ID) sfc flow classifier list ------------------------ List flow classifiers .. program:: sfc flow classifier list .. code:: bash openstack sfc flow classifier list [--long] sfc flow classifier show ------------------------ Show information of a given flow classifier .. program:: sfc flow classifier show .. code:: bash openstack sfc flow classifier show <flow-classifier> .. _sfc_flow_classifier_show-flow-classifier: .. describe:: <flow-classifier> Flow classifier to display (name or ID) sfc flow classifier set ----------------------- Set flow classifier information .. program:: sfc flow classifier set .. code:: bash openstack sfc flow classifier set [--description <description>] [--name <name>] <flow-classifier> .. option:: --description <description> Description for the flow classifier .. option:: --name <name> Name of the flow classifier .. _sfc_flow_classifier_set-flow-classifier: .. describe:: <flow-classifier> Flow classifier to modify (name or ID)

commit_message:
Add a functional test for nested get_attr functions

Nesting get_attr functions (i.e. using a get_attr in the arguments to
another get_attr) is unwise, and we probably should have prohibited it
somehow. Nonetheless, we didn't and some users (including but not
necessarily limited to TripleO) depend on this working. Since this would be
easy to break by accident, add a functional test to make sure we can only
break it on purpose.

Change-Id: I234a0762a00815af86b5711e7494366c16e717c2

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat_integrationtests.functional import functional_base initial_template = ''' heat_template_version: ocata resources: dict_resource: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: value: blarg: wibble foo: bar # This dependency is required by convergence - we don't know which # attributes of 'dict_resource' will be referenced by the 'value1' resource # unless we have the attribute values of 'key1' available, so those have to # be passed to 'dict_resource'. depends_on: - key1 key1: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: value: blarg key2: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: value: foo value1: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: value: get_attr: - dict_resource - value - {get_attr: [key1, value]} outputs: value1: value: {get_attr: [value1, value]} value2: value: {get_attr: [dict_resource, value, {get_attr: [key2, value]}]} ''' update_template = ''' heat_template_version: ocata resources: dict_resource: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: value: blarg: wibble foo: bar # This dependency is required by convergence - we don't know which # attributes of 'dict_resource' will be referenced by the 'value1' resource # unless we have the attribute values of 'key1' available, so those have to # be passed to 'dict_resource'. depends_on: - key1 key1: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: value: foo key2: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: value: blarg value1: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: value: get_attr: - dict_resource - value - {get_attr: [key1, value]} outputs: value1: value: {get_attr: [value1, value]} value2: value: {get_attr: [dict_resource, value, {get_attr: [key2, value]}]} ''' def get_output(outputs, key): for o in outputs['outputs']: if o['output_key'] == key: return o['output_value'] raise KeyError(key) class NestedGetAttrTest(functional_base.FunctionalTestsBase): def test_nested_get_attr_create(self): stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=initial_template) outputs = self.client.stacks.output_list(stack_identifier) self.assertEqual('wibble', get_output(outputs, 'value1')) self.assertEqual('bar', get_output(outputs, 'value2')) def test_nested_get_attr_update(self): stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=initial_template) self.update_stack(stack_identifier, template=update_template) outputs = self.client.stacks.output_list(stack_identifier) self.assertEqual('bar', get_output(outputs, 'value1')) self.assertEqual('wibble', get_output(outputs, 'value2'))

commit_message:
Split the ha env file and command parameters block

As rendered currently, this is confusing.  It sort of looks like the
cli parameters are supposed to be in the environment file.  This
change splits the block so it's clear that they are two separate
things.

Change-Id: I205908f4c1103fbfecc33fa6511b1d8b398fa8b0

commit_message:
Add Volume migrate action spec

This patch set adds volume migrate action spec.

Change-Id: Icb7a234040f4c81888fa2888000ab634ad7a121e
Implements: blueprint volume-migrate-action
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs refs/changes/17/468817/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Volume migrate action ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/watcher/+spec/volume-migrate-action Problem description =================== As of now, Watcher only provides Nova migrate action. Watcher needs cinder volume migrate action for optimizing storage provided by cinder. Use Cases ---------- * As a developer, I want to develop storage optimization strategy which migrates cinder volume. * As a developer, I want to develop zone migration strategy which migrates cinder volume. Proposed change =============== This spec adds storage migrate action. The shema is like the following:: schema = Schema({ 'resource_id': str, # should be a UUID 'migration_type': str, # choices -> "swap", "cold" 'destination_node': str, 'destination_type': str, }) Resource_id and migration_type are mandatory parameters. If migration_type is "cold", This action verifies that volume is detached and has no snapshots, then migrates detached volume of resource_id. If destination_node is added, first check if volume type of source node and destination node are the same. If true, this action migrates detached volume of resource_id to destination_node by calling Cinder migration API. If destination_type is added, first check if volume type of source node and destination node are different. If true, this action migrates detached volume of resource_id to destination_type by calling Cinder retype API. If migration_type is "swap", This action verifies that volume is attached and instance is active, paused, or resized statuses, then swap atached volume of resource_id. In this case, destination_type is mandatory. This action proceeds the following steps: - create a temporary user in the project which created source volume - create destination volume of destination_type by the temporary user - swap volume from source volume to destination volume by using Nova Update a volume attachment API - delete source volume - delete the temporary user Temporary user password is determined randomly for each user to reduce security risk as much as possible. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- If migration_type is swap, temporary user password can be security risk. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- If migration_type is swap, creation of temporary user or destination volume may exceed quota and result in error. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- The following is added in setup.cfg. :: [entry_points] watcher_actions = migrate = watcher.applier.actions.storage_migration:Migrate Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <nakamura-h> Other contributors: <adi-sky17> Work Items ---------- * Add volume migrate action * Add volume migrate action entry point in setup.cfg Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests should be updated. Documentation Impact ==================== Architecture documentation will be updated since action driver requests cinder API by this spec. References ========== * https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=#update-a-volume-attachment * https://docs.openstack.org/developer/cinder/devref/migration.html History ======= None

commit_message:
Fix incorrect django.conf.url patterns import

Remove Django patterns from code.
Patterns from django.conf.urls has been removed in Django 1.10.
Current Django version in devstack is 1.10.7
Remove global_settings.TEMPLATE_CONTEXT_PROCESSORS because this
variable has been removed in Django 1.10.

Story: 2001120
Task: 4811

Change-Id: I84a4aceb73abd37dab4acf43b9abf8b43c7f1625

commit_message:
Fix Horizon container starting if Watcher is enabled

When Watcher service is enabled, Horizon container failed to start.
Path to Horizon dashboard files was wrong.
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I8031612caf7c02e02f1079413ff8e648d1a4ca54
Closes-Bug: #1703971

commit_message:
[ci] Turn off glance scenarios

Glance doesn't work under uswgi. It fails too often(it is really hard to
find the patch where it passed the gates) and we are blocked by it.

This patch changes SLAs, so out gates will continue work, but we will
able to experiment with glance and try to find a solution

Change-Id: I7a45015c1b5ca613499f04b6f0398048e759fd62

commit_message:
Using fixtures instead of deprecated mockpatch module

This module mockpatch of oslotest[1] is deprecated since version 1.13
and may be removed in version 2.0. Use fixtures.Mock* classes instead[2]

[1]OpenStack Testing Framework and Utilities
[2]https://docs.openstack.org/oslotest/latest/api/oslotest.mockpatch.html#module-oslotest.mockpatch

Change-Id: I21306034427447221d2a27f5ed52a0f1fdb6a95e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslotest refs/changes/79/482879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import fixtures self.assertTrue(fixtures.MockPatchObject) self.assertTrue(fixtures.MockPatch) self.assertTrue(fixtures.MockPatchMultiple)
deleted_lines: from oslotest import mockpatch self.assertTrue(mockpatch.PatchObject) self.assertTrue(mockpatch.Patch) self.assertTrue(mockpatch.Multiple)

subject: Ensure mysql-python dependency met
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-13 09:35:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops/commit/9e3979729ba9bac15b28b8e1798c69a3b93758bc', 'message': 'Ensure mysql-python dependency met

`libmysqlclient-dev` is missing, when performing a Kilo to Newton upgrade
on a multi-node AIO, causing `mysql-python` to fail to install. This

commit_message:
Ensure mysql-python dependency met

`libmysqlclient-dev` is missing, when performing a Kilo to Newton upgrade
on a multi-node AIO, causing `mysql-python` to fail to install. This
change ensures it is present.

Change-Id: Id418929b1713357bea183c50b64219f175aee9bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/82/483282/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ensure mysql-python dependency met apt-get -y install libmysqlclient-dev > /dev/null

commit_message:
Ensure PIP requirements are always met

This change is necessary to ensure that all the required PIP packages
are installed. Without this change the code assumes that if the version
of `pip` in okay then all the required packages are already installed.

Change-Id: I16a4eaf24e346411a7f0890d69939f666ecc6be3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/81/483281/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Upgrade pip if it's needed. This will re-install pip using the constraints # Ensure all of the required packages are installed pip install --requirement "${SYSTEM_PATH}/lib/upgrade-requirements.txt" --upgrade --isolated
deleted_lines: # Upgrade pip if it's needed. This will re-install pip using the constraints and then # re-install all of the remaining requirements as needed. pip install --requirement "${SYSTEM_PATH}/lib/upgrade-requirements.txt" --upgrade --isolated

commit_message:
Fix depends-on kolla gates

When using depends-on, gates will not build cinder
and ceph images, causing ceph deploy gates to fail.

Change-Id: I441c742251754db27374331f774041c214678eba

commit_message:
INFINIDAT: Add QoS support

QoS is available in InfiniBox starting with version 4.0.
Older systems will report QoS_support=False.
If QoS is supported and there are QoS specs defined on the
volume type, the driver will apply them on the storage system.

Change-Id: Ic8c702eb95a8e8d5b598508e3072bf825b6f3de1
Implements: blueprint infinidat-qos
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/32/482132/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cinder.volume import volume_typesBACKEND_QOS_CONSUMERS = frozenset(['back-end', 'both']) QOS_MAX_IOPS = 'maxIOPS' QOS_MAX_BWS = 'maxBWS' VERSION = '1.4' def _get_backend_qos_specs(self, cinder_volume): type_id = cinder_volume.volume_type_id if type_id is None: return None qos_specs = volume_types.get_volume_type_qos_specs(type_id) if qos_specs is None: return None qos_specs = qos_specs['qos_specs'] if qos_specs is None: return None consumer = qos_specs['consumer'] # Front end QoS specs are handled by nova. We ignore them here. if consumer not in BACKEND_QOS_CONSUMERS: return None max_iops = qos_specs['specs'].get(QOS_MAX_IOPS) max_bws = qos_specs['specs'].get(QOS_MAX_BWS) if max_iops is None and max_bws is None: return None return { 'id': qos_specs['id'], QOS_MAX_IOPS: max_iops, QOS_MAX_BWS: max_bws, } def _get_or_create_qos_policy(self, qos_specs): qos_policy = self._system.qos_policies.safe_get(name=qos_specs['id']) if qos_policy is None: qos_policy = self._system.qos_policies.create( name=qos_specs['id'], type="VOLUME", max_ops=qos_specs[QOS_MAX_IOPS], max_bps=qos_specs[QOS_MAX_BWS]) return qos_policy def _set_qos(self, cinder_volume, infinidat_volume): if (hasattr(self._system.compat, "has_qos") and self._system.compat.has_qos()): qos_specs = self._get_backend_qos_specs(cinder_volume) if qos_specs: policy = self._get_or_create_qos_policy(qos_specs) policy.assign_entity(infinidat_volume) qos_support = (hasattr(self._system.compat, "has_qos") and self._system.compat.has_qos()) consistent_group_snapshot_enabled=True, QoS_support=qos_support) self._set_qos(volume, infinidat_volume)

commit_message:
Do not use lport.ofport in tunneling app

In an attempt to remove lport processing from DF controller, one of the
main hurdles is the local lport member ofport.

This change removes the usage of that member from the tunneling app.

Change-Id: If6237a19a6a1e75b795e5e74e2bd395a4374be83
Partial-Bug: #1690775

commit_message:
Update docs around custom roles

We now have additional tools for managing and updating the custom roles
for deployments. This change updates the docs with additional details
around the provided custom roles as well as including links to the
documentation around the role format.

Change-Id: I282bed83517abec10558f10af6f121e0eac10674
Related-Blueprint: example-custom-role-environments
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/36/476236/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Provided example roles ---------------------- TripleO offers a examplesroles provided in `openstack-tripleo-heat-templates`. These roles can be listed using the `tripleoclient` by running:: openstack overcloud role list With these provided roles, the user deploying the overcloud can generate a `roles_data.yaml` file that contains the roles they would like to use for the overcloud nodes. Additionally the user can manage their personal custom roles in a similar manor by storing the individual files in a directory and using the `tripleoclient` to generate their `roles_data.yaml`. For example, a user can the following to create a `roles_data.yaml` containing on the `Controler` and `Compute` roles:: openstack overcloud roles generate Controller Compute Each role is defined in the `roles_data.yaml` file. There is a sample file inrepository.1. Copy the default roles provided by `tripleo-heat-templates`: mkdir ~/roles cp /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/roles/* ~/roles 2. Create a new role file with your custom role. Additional details about the format for the roles file can be found in the `README.rst <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/roles/README.rst>_` in the roles/ directory from `tripleo-heat-templates`. The filename should match the name of the role. For example if adding a new role named `Galera`, the role file name should be `Galera.yaml`. The file should at least contain the following items: Additional items like the ones below should be included as well: * CountDefault: Default number of nodes, defaults to zero * HostnameFormatDefault: Format string for hostname, optional * Description: A few sentences describing the role and information pertaining to the usage of the role. The role file format is a basic yaml structure. The expectation is that there is a single role per file. See the roles `README.rst` for additional details. For example the following role might be used to deploy a pacemaker managed galera cluster::3. Create a `roles_data.yaml` file that contains the custom role in addition to the other roles that will be deployed. For example:: openstack overcloud roles generate --roles-path ~/roles -o ~/my_roles_data.yaml Controler Compute Galera 4. Pass the modified roles_data on deployment as follows:: Note that in your custom roles you should not use any already predefined name
deleted_lines: Each role is defined in the `roles_data.yaml` file (seerepository.)1. Copy the default roles_data.yaml:: cp /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/roles_data.yaml ~/my_roles_data.yaml 2. Edit my_roles_data.yaml to suit your requirements The roles_data is a simple list of roles, where the only mandatory argument is the name, and several optional additional keys are supported: * CountDefault: Default number of nodes, defaults to zero * HostnameFormatDefault: Format string for hostname, optional For example the following role would deploy a pacemaker managed galera cluster:: 3. Pass the modified roles_data on deployment as follows:: Note that in your custom roles you may not use any already predefined name

Tests: remove .testrepository/times.dbm in tox.ini

Existance of this file causes py3* tests to fail if
run after py27. This patch adds cleaning up of this
file before running py3* tests.

Related-Bug: #1229445

commit_message:
Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions

Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions. Nothing special is
required for this except for adding the appropriate distro variables
file and also update the zypper cache before package installation.

Change-Id: I0e6461262ddc40aae7dcc1d5595f00dc802d94c2

added_lines: update_cache: "{{ (ansible_pkg_mgr in ['apt', 'zypper']) | ternary('yes', omit) }}"

subject: Tests: Use recommended assertion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-13 07:24:51.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/actions/openstack/test_generator.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_environment.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_default_engine.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/services/test_expiration_policy.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_error_result.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_javascript_action.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/utils/test_utils.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_policies.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_subworkflows.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/services/test_action_service.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/services/test_workflow_service.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_dataflow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/lang/v2/test_workbook.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/5cc14ad1bbf901e0233674826521b4e74acaaed4', 'message': 'Tests: Use recommended assertion

In the test case, part of the cases is using the assertEqual, but the expected
value is empty, So in the case, assertEmpty is recommended, because it asserts
whether a sequence or collection is empty, same thing goes to assertListEqual,
assertDictEqual. This patch is to use assertEmpty instead

Change-Id: I27707cbfb0e0022e5bfa4feaa127810124180882
Closes-Bug: #1704033
'}]
commit_message:
Tests: Use recommended assertion

In the test case, part of the cases is using the assertEqual, but the expected
value is empty, So in the case, assertEmpty is recommended, because it asserts
whether a sequence or collection is empty, same thing goes to assertListEqual,
assertDictEqual. This patch is to use assertEmpty instead

Change-Id: I27707cbfb0e0022e5bfa4feaa127810124180882
Closes-Bug: #1704033
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/37/483237/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertEmpty(action_spec.get_input())

commit_message:
Add os-service-types repo to shade project

We've recently defined how to consume both official service-types and
their historical aliases, and we're publishing a json document with the
historical mapping. The next step is a simple python library that
encapsulates consuming that data.

Depends-On: If63f602e1e8a4ce3867b99adef5a07c29aa44630
Change-Id: I7621760d16c282c8671580e4f7be17ee1699e511

commit_message:
Add NODEPOOL_TARBALLS_PROXY to configure_mirror.sh

We now proxy tarballs.o.o via apache reverse proxy, add a variable to
make it easier for jobs to use it.

Change-Id: I6d8084c0d0443d9e499215acd06d24484d22f91a
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/06/483006/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export NODEPOOL_TARBALLS_PROXY=${NODEPOOL_TARBALLS_PROXY:-http://$NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST:8080/tarballs}

commit_message:
Add context function `url_pypi`

This is useful to unify the urls where we use pypi as source.

Change-Id: I59adcc7a6fd6ce1093d23ca9be4046e1e246cd02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/renderspec refs/changes/88/482088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context function `url_pypi` *************************** The function `url_pypi` return a full url to a sdist tar.gz tarball on pypi. The function requires the contect variables `upstream_version` and `pypi_name`. For example:: {% set pypi_name = 'oslo.concurrency' %} {% set upstream_version = upstream_version('3.20.0') %} {% set source = fetch_source(url_pypi()) %}

commit_message:
Add network/cidr mapping into ServiceNetMap

This can be consumed in service templates to set config values
which need to know what is the subnet where a deamon operates (for
example the Ceph Public vs Cluster network).

Change-Id: I1198c1e2212b7f670509cee0d5610e31209bb893

added_lines: subnet_cidr: value: {get_attr: ExternalSubnet, cidr}

commit_message:
Fix wrong snapshots usage display

When creating snapshot on the page of creating we can
see count of used snapshot that is based on tenants quotas.
But now we see volumes' usage instead of snapshots'.

This patch fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1703602
Change-Id: I3c8662108178628facac35def3707a8e926425d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/40/482540/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% block used %}{{ usages.volumesUsed|intcomma }}{% endblock %}{% blocktrans %} of {% endblocktrans %}{% block total %}{{ usages.maxTotalVolumes|intcomma|quotainf }}{% endblock %}{% blocktrans %} Used{% endblocktrans %}
deleted_lines: {% blocktrans with used=usages.volumesUsed|intcomma quota=usages.maxTotalVolumes|intcomma|quotainf %}{{ used }} of {{ quota }} Used{% endblocktrans %}

commit_message:
Added changes to run unit tests for Omni project using Zuul

Description:
- Omni project contains run_tests.sh, which performs following steps:.
1. We need to copy Omni drivers into individual components (Cinder, Glance, Nova, Neutron)
2. Modify test requirements of an individual Openstack component.
3. After executing Step 1 and Step 2, run "tox" command on each component.

Files Modified
- Added jenkins/jobs/omni.yaml: Contains job template for Omni project
- Updated jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml: Contains information about jobs to be run in a pipeline
- Updated zuul/layout.yaml: Added jobs for openstack/omni project

Change-Id: I3fdbb6d29da0f5af0b7690c3eb9d0a3801eb27f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/00/475300/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - job-template: name: '{pipeline}-omni-unittests' node: '{node}' wrappers: - build-timeout: timeout: 70 - timestamps builders: - link-logs - net-info - shell: | #!/bin/bash -xe export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export BRANCH_OVERRIDE={branch-override} if [ "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "default" ] ; then export OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH=$BRANCH_OVERRIDE fi function post_test_hook {{ # Configure and run unit tests $BASE/new/omni/run_tests.sh -j }} export -f post_test_hook publishers: - test-results - console-log

commit_message:
Split Neutron check queue grafana dashboard

There are too many jobs in one of the Failure Rate
panels for the Neutron check queue.  Split them into
two - one for grenade the other for tempest, just as
the gate queue does.

Change-Id: I240920276b0397a04263c1903f2feaa7ee4cb262

commit_message:
ironic: Add DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_INSPECTOR=1 for inspector jobs

Add DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_INSPECTOR=1 for inspector jobs so that we can
use this variable in devstack-gate/test-matrix.py so that the
inspector services get enabled.

Change-Id: I8f5319d3decadb384aed186f3616c3c6f4fa4fe4

commit_message:
Abort operation for live migration

This patch adds abort operation for live migration
to support abort in cancel action plan.

Change-Id: I458e93d9bd09dc4cf80cc941104129fc7600a6b1
Partially-Implements: blueprint cancel-action-plan

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack oslo_utils has a generate_uuid function for generating
uuids. We should use that function when generating uuids for
consistency.

Change-Id: Ib9d18363e9120eee6d6cbe0ef99fd80388c201a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/39/483239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import uuidutils RESOURCE_NAME_FORMAT = uuidutils.generate_uuid() candidate = os.path.join(root_dir, uuidutils.generate_uuid())
deleted_lines: import uuid RESOURCE_NAME_FORMAT = str(uuid.uuid4()) candidate = os.path.join(root_dir, str(uuid.uuid4()))

This patch adds bdm related data to InstancePayload. As loading BDM
can be expensive a new configuration flag 'bdms_in_notifications' is
introduced. If this is set to true (as by default) then the instance
notifications will contain 'null' value in block_devices field.
If this configuration flag is set to true then the block devices will
be loaded from the db and will be included in the notification payload.

Implements: bp additional-notification-fields-for-searchlight
Change-Id: I18e7483ec9a484a660e1d306fdc0986e1d5f952b

This patch adds bdm related data to InstancePayload. As loading BDM
can be expensive a new configuration flag 'bdms_in_notifications' is
introduced. If this is set to true (as by default) then the instance
notifications will contain 'null' value in block_devices field.
If this configuration flag is set to true then the block devices will
be loaded from the db and will be included in the notification payload.
Moreover BDM will not be loaded from the db if the notifications are in
general disabled in the configuration.

Implements: bp additional-notification-fields-for-searchlight
Change-Id: I18e7483ec9a484a660e1d306fdc0986e1d5f952b

This patch adds bdm related data to InstancePayload. As loading BDM
can be expensive a new configuration flag 'bdms_in_notifications' is
introduced. If this is set to false (as by default) then the instance
notifications will contain 'null' value in block_devices field.
If this configuration flag is set to true then the block devices will
be loaded from the db and will be included in the notification payload.
Moreover BDM will not be loaded from the db if the notifications are in
general disabled in the configuration.

Implements: bp additional-notification-fields-for-searchlight

"}, {'number': 34, 'created': '2017-06-30 07:30:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1ad7ac72e7efe28f86b95a562641d64a8b251b49', 'message': "Add BDM to InstancePayload

This patch adds bdm related data to InstancePayload. As loading BDM
can be expensive a new configuration flag 'bdms_in_notifications' is
introduced. If this is set to false (as by default) then the instance
notifications will contain 'null' value in block_devices field.
If this configuration flag is set to true then the block devices will
be loaded from the db and will be included in the notification payload.

Moreover BDM will not be loaded from the db if the notifications are in
general disabled in the configuration. To achieve this the
if_notifications_enabled decorator is added to multiple notification
method in nova.compute.utils.

Implements: bp additional-notification-fields-for-searchlight
Change-Id: I18e7483ec9a484a660e1d306fdc0986e1d5f952b
"}, {'number': 35, 'created': '2017-07-06 12:07:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7af96ab95f94ba132c0e722e1aace8f941b39f5b', 'message': "Add BDM to InstancePayload

can be expensive a new configuration flag 'bdms_in_notifications' is
introduced. If this is set to false (as by default) then the instance
notifications will contain 'null' value in block_devices field.
If this configuration flag is set to true then the block devices will

commit_message:
Add BDM to InstancePayload

This patch adds bdm related data to InstancePayload. As loading BDM
can be expensive a new configuration flag 'bdms_in_notifications' is
introduced. If this is set to false (as by default) then the instance
notifications will contain 'null' value in block_devices field.
If this configuration flag is set to true then the block devices will
be loaded from the db and will be included in the notification payload.

Implements: bp additional-notification-fields-for-searchlight
Change-Id: I18e7483ec9a484a660e1d306fdc0986e1d5f952b

commit_message:
Move import down to correct group

The "from keystone.common import utils" import was located
in the third-party group, which is the incorrect import group.

This change moves it from the group of third part imports to the
correct local import group to be more consistent with the rest
of keystone and to follow the pep8 guidelines.

Change-Id: I1d7124e67cd5a522eeafceacf05ca4ffac9d8b68

Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

subprocess module.

commit_message:
integration: Run gnocchi tempest tests

Pure functional tests of Gnocchi will soon not depends on devstack.
But we need to ensure we didn't break the tempest plugin for Gnocchi.
So we run it during the integration testing.

Change-Id: I16c6a2072cf080f76faf72ba2f1d98fddf84ad50

commit_message:
Increase the max_allowed_packet size in mysql's [server] stanza

It seems zaqar makes SQL requests that happen to be rather large in
size and the standard settings of mysql don't cope with that and return
the following error:

  ZaqarAction.queue_post failed: <class
  'zaqarclient.transport.errors.InternalServerError'>: Error response from
  Zaqar. Code: 500. Title: Internal server error. Description:
  (pymysql.err.OperationalError) (2013, 'Lost connection to MySQL server
  during query') [SQL: u'SELECT `Queues`.metadata \nFROM `Queues` \nWHERE
  `Queues`.project = %(project_1)s AND `Queues`.name = %(name_1)s']
  [parameters: {u'name_1': '2eff06e4-2712-4f78-8ab6-6b934c852aef',
  u'project_1': u'5ac518c14589482da9d97c4ca4a58b6a'}].]
  (execution_id=708639de-3a8f-4536-888c-31783f345757) 2017-05-19
  06:29:42.020 31478 INFO workflow_trace [-] Task 'send_message' [ERROR ->
  DELAYED, delay = 1 sec]
  (execution_id=708639de-3a8f-4536-888c-31783f345757
  task_id=de1c9cc5-2916-4459-8c9b-8c219d4e965d)

Let's increase the value to 32M (16M is the default server-side).

Co-Authored-By: Michel Bayer <mbayer@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1691951

Change-Id: I251fcc0445186781b43a9c5dabdca74bdb7be50a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/07/467707/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Revert "Fix a typo and complement doc in ceph-guide.rst"

This reverts commit 4e8bd619dda87c256ff6a06287de9d7c0f6c0dff.

The original doc is correct. The 5GB journal is create in ceph-osd
bootstrap script in kolla code base[0]. And there is no script to handle
KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D label too.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/docker/ceph/ceph-osd/extend_start.sh#L20,L24

Change-Id: Ia1b05af64915c204e185dccde30963d2ad1788ed

commit_message:
Fix gating

* Install mongodb

mongodb is not installed anymore

* cap pifpaf

Some libraries now use pbr>=2.0, recent cliff and stevedore.

* Add sqlalchemy_util to all tests because it's used by gabbi

* simplify crud notification test

test_alarms_sends_notification will hang forever if it fails.
we don't really need to test that its notification is received by
other, just that it sends a notification. drop the test so it
verifies only that.

Change-Id: I05462398ccce224ee1e008c5ad2eab64b975192c
(cherry picked from commit b231f83f381942a1dbc06ec6c36a54be73b46709)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 10:10:03.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ovs'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/908f0e4f049074664694b983393b9e716e60b1af', 'message': 'devstack ovs: get correct kernel rpm version on customed kernel

When building custom kernel version
uname -r returns 4.10.0-00054-ge4cd924

This is because dash is illegal character in rpm version

This patch fix the kernel version is rpm based OS

Change-Id: I3d0981fbe30f2436f00c200919b50aeb97491252

commit_message:
devstack ovs: get correct kernel rpm version on customed kernel

When building custom kernel version
uname -r returns 4.10.0-00054-ge4cd924
but the rpm name is kernel-4.10.0_00054_ge4cd924-1.x86_64
This is because dash is illegal character in rpm version

This patch fix the kernel version is rpm based OS
but converting all the dashes to underscores

Change-Id: I3d0981fbe30f2436f00c200919b50aeb97491252
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/47/480947/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KERNEL_VERSION=`uname -r` # dash is illegal character in rpm version so replace # them with underscore like it is done in the kernel # https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/scripts/package/mkspec#L25 KERNEL_VERSION=`echo $KERNEL_VERSION | sed -e "s/-/_/g"` echo NOTE: if kernel-devel-$KERNEL_VERSION or kernel-headers-$KERNEL_VERSION installation install_package kernel-devel-$KERNEL_VERSION install_package kernel-headers-$KERNEL_VERSION install_package linux-headers-$KERNEL_VERSION
deleted_lines: echo NOTE: if kernel-devel-$(uname -r) or kernel-headers-$(uname -r) installation install_package kernel-devel-$(uname -r) install_package kernel-headers-$(uname -r) install_package linux-headers-$(uname -r)

commit_message:
fixed health monitor creation during tempest test

`resource_set_health_monitor` is a class method, so the `cls` param will
be a class object and not an instantiated object, whereas
`_create_health_monitor` is not a classmethod can thus be called only
when bound to an object.

This fix keeps the method as classmethod and allows passing a `creater`
which can be used as factory of `health monitors`

Change-Id: I192bec90097be92fda122b01aebf9e820ea7bb67
Closes-bug: 1703597
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/34/482534/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def resource_set_health_monitor(cls, admin_state_up_flag, creator): cls.health_monitor = creator(**cls.create_hm_kwargs)

commit_message:
Change the default value for the config blazar_az_prefix

Current default value for the config 'blazar_az_prefix' is 'blazar:'.
However, ':' should not be included in the name of availability zones.

According to the parse_availability_zone() [1] of the API class of Nova,
there is a legacy hack to allow admins to specify hosts via an
availability zone using az:host:node. That means ':' cannot be included
in the name of an availability zone itself. But Nova accepts the
invalid name with ':'. That is reported as a bug [2].

This patch changes the default value for the config blazar_az_prefix
from 'blazar:' to 'blazar_' which does not use ':'.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/gitweb?p=openstack/nova.git;a=blob;f=nova/compute/api.py;h=46ed8e91fcc16f3755fd6a5e2e4a6d54f990cb8b;hb=HEAD#l561
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1695861

Change-Id: I3ad6f84c783d371d2eca2fc660bd564064df4586
Partial-Bug: #1695862
Depends-On: Iaff0b8e576dbcb56b89384ea236c3f121d4ffad1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar-nova refs/changes/90/471590/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default='blazar_',

commit_message:
Unity: Use thin clone when cloning volume

Unity storage now supports cloning volume by taking its snapshot,
it's more efficient than previous implementation.

However, there is limitation on the count of thin clones inside one LUN
family sharing the same base LUN. Every time the limitation reaches, a
new volume will be cloned using `dd` copy. Then thin clone will be taken
from the new dd-copied volume.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint unity-fast-clone

Change-Id: I5e4264ce9917e831e3efe27dc332641c9f94c07f

commit_message:
Update urls to Django 1.8 style

django.conf.urls.patterns() is deprecated since 1.8
We cannot use patterns() anymore.

Change-Id: I2a84a1ec7aebcbc488ae668e3a076bf9d72b0acf
Closes-Bug: #1703225

commit_message:
Extra compute services_client API endpoints

This patch:
  - adds ``disable_log_reason`` and ``update_forced_down`` API
    endpoints to the compute ``services_client``
  - adds corresponding unit tests and schemas
    (for 2.11 microversion)
  - changes ``host_name`` parameter in the unit tests for
    ``services_client`` to ``host`` because ``host_name``
    is wrong; see [0] for example

However, this patch does not add API tests for these endpoints
because they result in compute services being forced down
or disabled, which are dangerous to test in the gates.

Valid use cases for these APIs include:
  - negative testing
  - RBAC testing (forcing a BadRequest but ensuring policy enforcement
    happens beforehand)

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#update-forced-down

Change-Id: I641218e104bba55e3679a7111e7f3d042ad7665b

commit_message:
Fix quota class set APIs

v2.1 API which does not return the 'server_groups' and
'server_group_members' quotas in GET & PUT os-quota-class-sets
API response. v2 API used to return those keys in API response.

Also filter out the network related quotas from os-quota-class-sets
APIs

Fixing this with microversion.
Closes-Bug: #1701211
Closes-Bug: #1693168
implement-blueprint fix-quota-classes-api

Change-Id: I66aeb7a92fb5ee906fead78030bd84a2e97916e8

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-13 01:42:14.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/v2/test_claims.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/32643d2cf890cd5a95f728e5d5acc7d6ca332cc1', 'message': 'Support tempest for dead letter queue

Implement blueprint dead-letter-queue and add tempest for dead letter queue.

commit_message:
Support tempest for dead letter queue

Implement blueprint dead-letter-queue and add tempest for dead letter queue.

Change-Id: Ie5bd5a21a995f91d53e9d26cf8a2610d007d5bb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/52/483152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('c1975970-66e7-11e7-a771-fa163e40e1ff') def test_dead_letter_queue(self): # Post Messages DLQ_name = "DLQ" meta = {'ttl': 3, 'grace': 3} self.client.create_queue(DLQ_name) # Set dead letter queeu metadata metadata = {"_max_claim_count": 2, "_dead_letter_queue": DLQ_name, "_dead_letter_queue_messages_ttl": 9999} self.client.set_queue_metadata(self.queue_name, metadata) new_messages = [{'ttl': 3600, 'body': {"key": "value"}}] self.client.post_messages(queue_name=self.queue_name, rbody=message_body) claim_id, messages = self.client.post_claims(queue_name=self.queue_name, rbody=meta) self.assertIsNotNone(claim_id) self.assertEqual(1, len(list(messages))) time.sleep(5) claim_id, messages = self.client.post_claims(queue_name=self.queue_name, rbody=meta) self.assertIsNotNone(claim_id) messages = list(messages) self.assertEqual(1, len(messages)) time.sleep(5) claim_id, messages = self.client.post_claims(queue_name=self.queue_name, rbody=meta) self.assertIsNone(claim_id) self.assertEqual(0, len(list(messages))) time.sleep(5) DLQ_messages = self.client.list(DLQ_name, include_claimed=True) expected_msg = list(next(DLQ_messages))[0] self.assertEqual(9999, expected_msg["ttl"]) self.assertEqual({"key": "value"}, expected_msg["body"]) # Delete dead letter queue self.client.delete_queue(DLQ_name)

commit_message:
Increases code coverage

Covers manilaclient/common/apiclient/auth.py:discover_auth_systems().

Coverage for manilaclient/common/apiclient/auth.py goes from 0% to 35%.
Overall coverage goes from 71% to 74%.

Partial-Bug: #1364800

commit_message:
Fix ironic-pxe startup issues

This patch updates the ironic-api docker service so that it
generates its config files in a unique config root. This
ensures that it doesn't have config files in the httpd
conf.d directory for both the API and PXE services thus
causing the API container to attempt to launch both of them.

This functionally fixes the Ironic API and PXE services with
docker so they once again can bring up an overcloud.

Change-Id: I537cd6a3337bf776ca38a279b7c130b6429eea04
Closes-bug: #1702799

commit_message:
Add monkey_patch to demo code.

The RPC server code can not work if we
don't add eventlet.monkey_patch() at the
begining.

Change-Id: I65a162a427fb5615c95a70e6d1bbec899a78f231
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/76/480876/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import eventlet eventlet.monkey_patch() *Note:* Because we are using eventlet executor and time.sleep(1) and we don't monkey-patching the server code. So we need to add:: import eventlet eventlet.monkey_patch()

commit_message:
Add support for versionadded and deprecated

This patch adds support for the versionadded, versionchanged and
deprecated tags. It also reduces the rather aggressive margins and
padding around the admonitions, so that they stack a little better,
and adds a missing icon to the 'seealso' admonition.

Adds example admonitions to the Demo documentation.

Change-Id: Ieb064b26980f885549660a80e2a2578b71a5e7b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/65/482265/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
$('div.versionadded > p').prepend('
 
'); $('div.deprecated > p').prepend('
 
');

commit_message:
Add security groups and security group rules to OVNClient

This patch is adding the security groups and security group rules
resources to the OVNClient so later we can use it for journaling.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: I452819c95173ca9a653a7557fdd7eeac6e4047d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/76/475776/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sg = {'name': kwargs['security_group']['name'], 'id': kwargs['security_group']['id']} if event == events.AFTER_CREATE: self._ovn_client.create_security_group(sg) elif event == events.AFTER_UPDATE: self._ovn_client.update_security_group(sg) elif event == events.BEFORE_DELETE: self._ovn_client.delete_security_group(sg) if event == events.AFTER_CREATE: self._ovn_client.create_security_group_rule( kwargs.get('security_group_rule')) elif event == events.BEFORE_DELETE: self._ovn_client.delete_security_group_rule( kwargs.get('security_group_rule_id'))
deleted_lines: sg = kwargs.get('security_group') external_ids = {ovn_const.OVN_SG_NAME_EXT_ID_KEY: sg['name']} with self._nb_ovn.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for ip_version in ['ip4', 'ip6']: if event == events.AFTER_CREATE: txn.add(self._nb_ovn.create_address_set( name=utils.ovn_addrset_name(sg['id'], ip_version), external_ids=external_ids)) elif event == events.AFTER_UPDATE: txn.add(self._nb_ovn.update_address_set_ext_ids( name=utils.ovn_addrset_name(sg['id'], ip_version), external_ids=external_ids)) elif event == events.BEFORE_DELETE: txn.add(self._nb_ovn.delete_address_set( name=utils.ovn_addrset_name(sg['id'], ip_version))) sg_id = None sg_rule = None is_add_acl = True admin_context = n_context.get_admin_context() if event == events.AFTER_CREATE: sg_rule = kwargs.get('security_group_rule') sg_id = sg_rule['security_group_id'] elif event == events.BEFORE_DELETE: sg_rule = self._plugin.get_security_group_rule( admin_context, kwargs.get('security_group_rule_id')) sg_id = sg_rule['security_group_id'] is_add_acl = False # TODO(russellb) It's possible for Neutron and OVN to get out of sync # here. If updating ACls fails somehow, we're out of sync until another # change causes another refresh attempt. ovn_acl.update_acls_for_security_group(self._plugin, admin_context, self._nb_ovn, sg_id, sg_rule, is_add_acl=is_add_acl)

commit_message:
Use pbr autodoc feature rather than custom logic

zun-ui doc/source/conf.py has a custom logic which prepare index files
for autodoc, but now pbr and sphinx autodoc have a feature to do it and
it is no a good idea to keep the custom logic.

UI cookiecutter populates the custom logic and it is an example of
the clean up.

Change-Id: I6c6eb2f6292bda30a4fa8d4375defd8234463008
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun-ui refs/changes/14/482914/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [pbr] autodoc_index_modules = True api_doc_dir = contributor/api

commit_message:
ovs-fw: Use TRANSIENT table for traffic classification

Commit ce8a0b2b7d73caf078c6634d6dded5117dbed265 introduces a TRANSIENT
table where all traffic local to br-int is sent after it's been
preprocessed by other features using openflow. This patch adopts the
table.

Change-Id: Ic66c186ab73bad6fcd133f2b9d15e07fd0eebb33
Related-bug: #1696983

Fix some errors and warnings

- Dictionary contains duplicate keys.
- Unexpected arguments.
- Missed call to __init__ of super class.
- Missing import i18n marker function in zun/api/controllers/v1/images.py.

Change-Id: I75c3ce3049ff62ae08868fdcce680945783690fd
Partials-Bug: #1702587

commit_message:
improve notification short-circuit

The patch I3e6741d59df49e1e58409314008c2ed609fdedc1 introduced a way to
not generate notification payload data if the notification will not be
sent out in the end. This patch spread the usage of the decorator to
more versioned notification methods.

Change-Id: I04bb4f3a34c98227793136124ec6076a3a95c75f

commit_message:
Query deleted instance records during _destroy_evacuated_instances

_destroy_evacuated_instances is responsible for cleaning up the
remnants of instance evacuations from the source host. Currently
this method doesn't account for instances that have been deleted
after being evacuated.

Change-Id: Ib5f6b03189b7fc5cd0b226ea2dca74865fbef12a
Closes-Bug: #1687479

commit_message:
Test Creation of server in a shared_network

Add test to create a server in a shared network
   -Create a shared network as a admin
   -Create a router and subnet
   -Create a server
   -Check tenant network connectivity
   -Check public network connectivity

Change-Id: If19f11be280501de9f0e624565530228109a9f07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/10/168910/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.idempotent_id('2c0d5792-a04a-44e1-b95b-cbb9c4597c7e') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_creeation_of_vm_in_shared_network(self): network_id = CONF.network.public_network_id name = 'shared_network' client = self.admin_network_client tenant_id = client.tenant_id self.security_group = \ self._create_security_group(tenant_id=self.tenant_id) net_result = self.admin_network_client.create_network(name=name, shared=True) network = net_resources.DeletableNetwork(client=client, **net_result['network']) self.addCleanup(super(TestNetworkBasicOps, self).delete_wrapper, network.delete) router = super(TestNetworkBasicOps, self)._create_router() router.set_gateway(network_id) kwargs = dict(network=network, client=client) subnet = super(TestNetworkBasicOps, self)._create_subnet(**kwargs) subnet.add_to_router(router.id) name = data_utils.rand_name('server-smoke') server = self._create_server(name, network) self._check_tenant_network_connectivity() floating_ip = self.create_floating_ip(server) self.floating_ip_tuple = Floating_IP_tuple(floating_ip, server) self.check_public_network_connectivity( should_connect=True)
